Articles.Content: Are the Banshee lift fans meant to use oxidizer? They are on the latest version

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, oniontrain said:
> 
> 
> Are the Banshee lift fans meant to use oxidizer? They are on the latest version
> 

There's a module manager patch in the "Extras" folder you can use to make them run on EC.

Reference: [https://github.com/SuicidalInsanity/Mk2Expansion/tree/master/Mk2Expansion/Extras/Mk2Expansion/Patches](https://github.com/SuicidalInsanity/Mk2Expansion/tree/master/Mk2Expansion/Extras/Mk2Expansion/Patches)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-11-02T04:43:58Z" title="11/02/2017 04:43  AM" data-short="6 yr">November 2, 2017</time> by Supercheese**

> 
> 
> 19 hours ago, Supercheese said:
> 
> 
> There's a module manager patch in the "Extras" folder you can use to make them run on EC.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Reference: [https://github.com/SuicidalInsanity/Mk2Expansion/tree/master/Mk2Expansion/Extras/Mk2Expansion/Patches](https://github.com/SuicidalInsanity/Mk2Expansion/tree/master/Mk2Expansion/Extras/Mk2Expansion/Patches)
> 

All the other engines seem to just use liquid fuel, it seems like an error.

@ Grand Ship Builder: If you're in 1.3, can you verify your IFS is v2.9.5?  

Log is at Kerbal Space Program/KSP.log. Either Kerbal Space Program/KSP\_Data or Kerbal Space Program/KSP\_x64\_Data [whichever is appropriate]/Output\_log.txt would also work.

@oniontrain: Banshee fans use <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/O by default, and have since their introduction; it was a convenient way to allow them to work off Kerbin. The Extras folder packaged with Mk2Expansion has a pair of <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patches to convert them to use either <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/Air or Ec.

Turns out not. But then, as soon as I checked, Mk2 expansion update came out. Gonna try to calibrate.

> @oniontrain: Banshee fans use <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/O by default, and have since their introduction; it was a convenient way to allow them to work off Kerbin. The Extras folder packaged with Mk2Expansion has a pair of <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patches to convert them to use either <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/Air or Ec.
> 

Ah so they use it to avoid doing a config for intakeatm? I've already built an unstable <abbr title="Vertical Take-Off and Landing">VTOL</abbr> using <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/O so it's not big deal.

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, oniontrain said:
> 
> 
> Ah so they use it to avoid doing a config for intakeatm? I've already built an unstable <abbr title="Vertical Take-Off and Landing">VTOL</abbr> using <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/O so it's not big deal.
> 

I think it's more like, before IntakeAtm existed, they had the <abbr title="Liquid Fuel and Oxidizer">LFO</abbr> option.

Not quite. The fans make use of a custom FanIntakeAtm (identical to IntakeAtm, except this way the lift fans don't unintentionally double as giant 2m air intakes) as well, but its universal, regardless of the fuel type (<abbr title="Liquid Fuel">Lf</abbr>/Air|<abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/O|Ec) used, so it doesn't get mentioned. <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/O was chosen as the default as fan use off Kerbin was intended where IntakeAir may not be present, and if building something with the fans out of Mk2 parts, chances there's a stock <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/O Mk2 tank in there somewhere already, so why not take advantage of existing tankage?

> 
> 
> On 8/30/2017 at 5:29 PM, SuicidalInsanity said:
> 
> 
> @HaydenTheKing: The Hyperblast is a scramjet; like IRL scramjet prototypes, you have to meet minimum speed requirements before it will begin to work. In game terms, treat it like any other second stage rocket motor you might use for a <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> - get the craft up to speed on jets, then switch over to it to get (sub)orbital; only difference is it runs on <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/Air/Speed, instead of <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/O. A tutorial can be found here:
> 
> 
> <iframe data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed1944652346" frameborder="0" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/109145-13-mk2-expansion-v177-update-7152017/&page=29&do=embed&comment=2818873&embedComment=2818873&embedDo=findComment#comment-2818873" style="height:295px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>
> 

These links (in the first post as well as the quoted post on page 39) both just direct me back to the first post of this thread. Does anyone know where this tutorial is actually located?

Edit: Argh, it's actually just some annoying forum usability BS. It turns out that the ***little tiny diagonal arrow graphic*** in the very upper left corner that I didn't even notice until after looking at the dang thing a dozen times and carefully mousing over every bit of it, hunting for something that gave a different URL tooltip... anyway, *that little arrow* is actually the link to the post containing the tutorial, while the big header line below which LOOKS like what you're supposed to click on is just telling you what thread it was posted to... and directing you to its first post, as if that big bold link to the first post was more important than *the post you're actually trying to reach.*

**Edited <time datetime="2017-11-06T23:35:24Z" title="11/06/2017 11:35  PM" data-short="6 yr">November 6, 2017</time> by Tallinu**

Page 29.  

Its a vagary of how the forum software handles links - apparently you have to click the 'SuicidalInsanity replied to a topic October 22, 2016' bit at the very top to go to the linked post, otherwise it thinks you just want to go to the linked thread's <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr>.  

i should probably get around to replacing that with a video tutorial one of these days.

Ah, that portion has the right link too, okay.

At any rate, having now read that tutorial, it seems relatively straightforward (although a slightly non-trivial flight plan, at least for that particular vehicle design). Of course, that said, I still haven't managed to build a spaceplane that can actually do anything useful! XD (Was trying desperately to make one for simple orbital tourism or crew transport that could be used with mid-game tech earlier in the year, but couldn't even get something that simple to reach space reliably...)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-11-07T06:10:52Z" title="11/07/2017 06:10  AM" data-short="6 yr">November 7, 2017</time> by Jalaris**
is there a way to disable the 'catastrophic overheating imminent' message for the engines?

> 
> 
> 16 minutes ago, halowraith1 said:
> 
> 
> is there a way to disable the 'catastrophic overheating imminent' message for the engines?
> 

Alt+F12 > Cheats > Ignore Max Temperature

> 
> 
> 49 minutes ago, Grand Ship Builder said:
> 
> 
> Alt+F12 > Cheats > Ignore Max Temperature
> 

engine still shuts off at high temp. in fact the engine barely runs; as soon as it is at a suitable speed it has already overheated.
Bug as in inaccurate description: NUK 3 fission reactor says it processes "0.00 uranium per day". Either its a veeeery small rate or just wrong number.

>

> @oniontrain: Banshee fans use <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/O by default, and have since their introduction; it was a convenient way to allow them to work off Kerbin. The Extras folder packaged with Mk2Expansion has a pair of <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patches to convert them to use either <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/Air or Ec.
> 

My question is: If one applies **both** patches, will the fan be able to switch between modes? If not, could a patch be written to add such functionality, either in-flight, or restricted to the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>/<abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr>?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, grungar3x7 said:
> 
> 
> My question is: If one applies **both** patches, will the fan be able to switch between modes? If not, could a patch be written to add such functionality, either in-flight, or restricted to the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>/<abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr>?
> 

I've made it another way - I modified the patch a bit to create a copy of Banshee with slightly different name and EC as the power source.

> 
> 
> 11 minutes ago, whale\_2 said:
> 
> 
> I've made it another way - I modified the patch a bit to create a copy of Banshee with slightly different name and EC as the power source.
> 

Please elaborate, good kerbaleer. I feel I should inform you however, that I am not exactly fluent in patch/code stuff, so go easy on me!

> 
> 
> 27 minutes ago, SuicidalInsanity said:
> 
> 
> ...  
> 
> @grungar3x7: ... The way <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> syntax works, applying both the AirbreathingBanshee and the ElectricBanshee patch would either result in it requiring Ec or both Ec and Oxidizer. The other reason for the patches is the stock engine code does not allow tri-mode engines.  
> <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> part duplication is easy. You'll want something along the lines of:  
> 
> +PART[M2X\_FuselageLiftFan] {  
> 
> @name = ElectricFuselageFan  
> 
> @title = Sp-NR 'Poltergeist' Lift Fan  
> 
> @MODULE[ModuleEnginesFX] {  
> 
> @PROPELLANT[LiquidFuel] {  
> 
> @name =  ElectricCharge  
> 
> @ratio = 10000 } //about 10-ish Ec/s  
> 
> !PROPELLANT[Oxidizer] {} }  
> 
> !MODULE[ModuleAlternator] {} }  
>   
> 
> +PART[M2X\_LiftFan] {  
> 
> @name = ElectricFan  
> 
> @title = Sp-NR 'Poltergeist' Lift Fan (2 variants)  
> 
> @MODULE[ModuleEnginesFX] {  
> 
> @PROPELLANT[LiquidFuel] {  
> 
> @name =  ElectricCharge  
> 
> @ratio = 10000 }  
> 
> !PROPELLANT[Oxidizer] {} }  
> 
> !MODULE[ModuleAlternator] {} }
> 

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, whale\_2 said:
> 
> 
> This one works for me :
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     
>     
>     //Use this patch to add Electric Banshee lift fans using ElectricCharge.
>     
>     +PART[M2X_FuselageLiftFan]:FOR[Mk2Expansion]
>     {@name = M2X_FuselageLiftFan_E@title = D-ZZY-E 'Banshee' Lift Fan (Electric)@description = A 2 meter internal fuselage mounted lift fan for vertical propulsion in atmospheric environments lacking oxygen, this engine is designed to allow VTOL applications on bodies where jets cannot function and rockets would be prohibitively inefficient. Although it is lighter and cheaper than a jet engine, it is also comparatively less powerful. This one is ventrally mounted in a fuselage housing. (Electrically driven)@MODULE[ModuleEnginesFX]   {	@PROPELLANT[LiquidFuel] 	{		@name =  ElectricCharge		@ratio = 10000	}	!PROPELLANT[Oxidizer] {}	!PROPELLANT[IntakeAir] {}}!MODULE[ModuleAlternator] {}
>     }
>     +PART[M2X_LiftFan]:FOR[Mk2Expansion]
>     {@name = M2X_LiftFan_E@title = D-ZZY-E 'Banshee' Lift Fan (2 variants) (Electric)@description = A 2 meter side-mounted lift fan for vertical propulsion in atmospheric environments lacking oxygen, this engine is designed to allow VTOL applications on bodies where jets cannot function and rockets would be prohibitively inefficient. Although it is lighter and cheaper than a jet engine, it is also comparatively less powerful. (Electrically driven)
>     @MODULE[ModuleEnginesFX]   {	@PROPELLANT[LiquidFuel] 	{		@name =  ElectricCharge		@ratio = 10000	}	!PROPELLANT[Oxidizer] {}	!PROPELLANT[IntakeAir] {}}!MODULE[ModuleAlternator] {}
>     }
> 

Thank you both, so much, for these tips!

**Edited <time datetime="2017-11-20T20:02:25Z" title="11/20/2017 08:02  PM" data-short="6 yr">November 20, 2017</time> by grungar3x7**
  
Removing unnecessary lines.

I'm having a problem with all the cockpits in this mod. It shows the correct mass in the part selector, but the real mass is much lower. Like a cockpit that shows 2 t, when used only add 0.3 t to the craft. All the other parts seems to be ok.
Off-topic politics removed

@KerbalFreak: Best guess without additional information is some other mod or <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch is adjusting cockpit weights; there's nothing in stock or M2X by itself that would cause that.
